company.name: Instant Checkmate, Inc.
company.address: 4110 Mission Boulevard, Suite 200, San Diego, CA 92109
company.business_description: Instant Checkmate operates an online service allowing consumers to request background reports about individuals. The company obtains public information from third-party data providers and assembles it into detailed reports containing up to fifteen information items, including current and previous addresses, arrest and conviction records, marriage or divorce records, birth certificate records, and government-issued licenses. Consumers may purchase reports individually or subscribe for unlimited searching.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a); and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

complaint.factual_background: Instant Checkmate operated an online background check service that provided detailed reports about individuals to consumers. The company marketed these reports for use in employment and tenant screening decisions, which made them consumer reports under the FCRA. However, Instant Checkmate failed to comply with any of the Fair Credit Reporting Act requirements applicable to consumer reporting agencies, including procedures to verify user identity and permissible purposes, ensure accuracy of information, or provide required notices to users.

representations_made.description: Promoted use of reports for tenant screening
representations_made.quoted_text: 5 GOOD REASONS to get instant criminal checks on anyone right now . . . (2) Check out tenants before they rent.

representations_made.description: Recommended performing searches on babysitters, daycare workers, gardeners, and housecleaners
representations_made.quoted_text: Who should I perform a search on? Our lead background check analyst recommends you perform searches on the following people: . . . o Babysitter/Daycare Worker . . . o Gardener/Housecleaner . . .

representations_made.description: Claimed background checks are requested by employers for job candidates
representations_made.quoted_text: Most of the time background checks are requested by an employer to get as much information on a potential job candidate.

representations_made.description: Promoted use for employment screening of high security or trust positions
representations_made.quoted_text: Some employers seek out background checkers concerning prospective employees. They are especially useful when employers are seeking candidates that require high security or a position of trust.

representations_made.description: Advertised background checks for nannies, babysitters, maids, and housekeepers through Google AdWords
representations_made.quoted_text: The company, through its Google Ad Words ad campaign, ran advertisements that would appear in search results when users sought background checks on "nannies," "babysitters," "maids," and "housekeepers."

representations_made.description: Banner ads promoted tenant screening use
representations_made.quoted_text: RUN A BACKGROUND CHECK ON ANYONE ONLINE IN SECONDS 5 GOOD REASONS: . . . Check Out Tenants Before They Rent . . .

counts.title: Failure to Maintain Reasonable Procedures to Limit Furnishing of Consumer Reports
counts.representation: Section 607(a) of the FCRA requires that every CRA maintain reasonable procedures to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to those with permissible purposes, require prospective users to identify themselves and certify purposes, and verify user identity and uses
counts.fact: Defendant failed to maintain reasonable procedures required by Section 607(a). For example, it failed to require that prospective users identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose. It also failed to make reasonable efforts to verify the identity of each prospective user and the uses certified by each prospective user prior to furnishing such user with a consumer report
counts.conclusion: Defendant has violated Section 607(a) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(a), and these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act

counts.title: Failure to Follow Reasonable Procedures to Assure Maximum Possible Accuracy
counts.representation: Section 607(b) of the FCRA requires CRAs to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates
counts.fact: Defendant failed to use reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer report information
counts.conclusion: Defendant has violated Section 607(b) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(b), and these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts and practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act

counts.title: Failure to Provide Required User Notice
counts.representation: Section 607(d) of the FCRA requires that a CRA provide a notice to users of information that states users' responsibilities under the FCRA
counts.fact: Defendant failed to provide a notice to users of information that states their respective responsibilities under the FCRA
counts.conclusion: Defendant has violated Section 607(d) of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681e(d), and these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act

counts.title: Furnishing Consumer Reports Without Permissible Purpose
counts.representation: Section 604 of the FCRA prohibits a CRA from furnishing consumer reports to persons that it did not have reason to believe had a permissible purpose to obtain a consumer report
counts.fact: Defendant furnished consumer reports to persons that it did not have reason to believe had permissible purposes to obtain such reports. Indeed, Instant Checkmate regularly provided consumer reports without knowing users' purposes for obtaining the reports and without employing procedures for requesting users' purposes for obtaining the reports
counts.conclusion: Defendant has violated Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681b, and these acts also constitute unfair or deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act

definitions.Clear and Prominent: 1. in textual communications (e.g., printed publications or words displayed on the screen of a computer), the required disclosures are of a type, size, and location sufficiently noticeable for an ordinary consumer to read and comprehend them, in print that contrasts with the background on which they appear; 2. in communications disseminated orally or through audible means (e.g., radio or streaming audio), the required disclosures are delivered in a volume and cadence sufficient for an ordinary consumer to hear and comprehend them; 3. in communications disseminated through video means (e.g., television or streaming video), the required disclosures are in writing in a form consistent with subparagraph (1) of this definition and shall appear on the screen for a duration sufficient for an ordinary consumer to read and comprehend them, and in the same language as the predominant language that is used in the communication; 4. in communications made through interactive media, such as the Internet, online services, and software, the required disclosures are unavoidable and presented in a form consistent with subparagraph (1) of this definition, in addition to any audio or video presentation of them; and 5. in all instances, the required disclosures are presented in an understandable language and syntax, and with nothing contrary to, inconsistent with, or in mitigation of the disclosures used in any communication of them.
definitions.Consumer Report: any written, oral, or other communication of any information by a Consumer Reporting Agency bearing on a consumer's credit worthiness, credit standing, credit capacity, character, general reputation, personal characteristics, or mode of living which is used or expected to be used or collected in whole or in part for the purpose of serving as a factor in establishing the consumer's eligibility for: 1. credit or insurance to be used primarily for personal, family, or household purposes; 2. employment purposes; or 3. any other Permissible Purpose.
definitions.Consumer Reporting Agency: any Person which, for monetary fees, dues, or on a cooperative nonprofit basis, regularly engages in whole or in part in the practice of assembling or evaluating consumer credit information or other information on consumers for the purpose of furnishing Consumer Reports to third parties, and which uses any means or facility of interstate commerce for the purpose of preparing or furnishing Consumer Reports.
definitions.Defendant: Instant Checkmate Inc. and its successors and assigns
definitions.Permissible Purpose: the circumstances under which a Consumer Reporting Agency may furnish a Consumer Report, as set forth in Section 604 of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. § 1681b, attached hereto as Attachment A to this Order.
definitions.Person: any individual, partnership, corporation, trust, estate, cooperative, association, government or governmental subdivision or agency, or other entity.

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently restrained from furnishing consumer reports without permissible purpose, failing to maintain reasonable procedures to verify users and ensure accuracy, and failing to provide required notices to users.

requirements.description: Must not furnish a Consumer Report to any Person who Defendant does not have reason to believe has a Permissible Purpose
requirements.quoted_text: furnishing a Consumer Report to any Person who Defendant does not have reason to believe has a Permissible Purpose to receive the Consumer Report

requirements.description: Must not fail to maintain reasonable procedures designed to limit furnishing of Consumer Reports to Persons that have Permissible Purposes, including requiring user identification, certification, and verification
requirements.quoted_text: failing to maintain reasonable procedures designed to limit the furnishing of Consumer Reports to Persons that have Permissible Purposes to receive them. Such reasonable procedures shall require that: prospective users of the information identify themselves, certify the purposes for which the information is sought, and certify that the information will be used for no other purpose; and that Defendant make a reasonable effort to verify the identity of a new prospective user and the uses certified by such prospective user prior to furnishing such user a Consumer Report

requirements.description: Must not fail to maintain reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of information in Consumer Reports
requirements.quoted_text: failing to maintain reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom a Consumer Report relates

requirements.description: Must not fail to provide a notice (attached as Attachment B) to any person to whom a Consumer Report is provided, with electronic notice permitted if user obtains reports electronically and notice is Clear and Prominent
requirements.quoted_text: failing to provide a notice identical or substantially similar to the one attached as Attachment B to this Order, to any person to whom a Consumer Report is provided by Defendant, provided that Defendant may provide an electronic copy of the notice to a user if: (a) in the ordinary course of business, the user obtains Consumer Report information from Defendant in electronic form, and (b) the notice is Clear and Prominent.

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $525,000 to the United States for violations of the FCRA.

requirements.description: Pay $525,000 to the Treasurer of the United States by electronic fund transfer
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant is ordered to pay Plaintiff, by making payment to the Treasurer of the United States, Five Hundred Twenty-Five Thousand Dollars ($525,000), which, as Defendant stipulates, its undersigned counsel holds for no purpose other than payment to Plaintiff. Such payment must be made within seven (7) days of entry of this Order by electronic fund transfer in accordance with instructions previously provided by a representative of Plaintiff.

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, and facts alleged in the Complaint will be taken as true in future enforcement litigation.

requirements.description: Relinquish dominion and all legal and equitable right, title, and interest in all assets transferred pursuant to this Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant relinquishes dominion and all legal and equitable right, title, and interest in all assets transferred pursuant to this Order and may not seek the return of any assets.

requirements.description: Acknowledge that Taxpayer Identification Numbers may be used for collecting and reporting on any delinquent amount arising out of this Order
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant acknowledges that its Taxpayer Identification Numbers (Social Security Numbers or Employer Identification Numbers), which Defendant previously submitted to the Commission, may be used for collecting and reporting on any delinquent amount arising out of this Order, in accordance with 31 U.S.C. §7701.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgements
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit its own acknowledgment of receipt and deliver copies of the Order to principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, and agents for three years, obtaining signed acknowledgments from each.

requirements.description: Submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant, within seven (7) days of entry of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order sworn under penalty of perjury.

requirements.description: For three years after entry of this Order, deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees and agents who participate in conduct related to the subject matter, and any business entity resulting from change in structure
requirements.quoted_text: For three (3) years after entry of this Order, Defendant must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees, agents, and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Section titled "Compliance Reporting." Delivery must occur within seven (7) days of entry of this Order for current personnel. To all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.

requirements.description: Obtain a signed and dated acknowledgement of receipt of this Order from each individual or entity to which Defendant delivered a copy
requirements.quoted_text: From each individual or entity to which Defendant delivered a copy of this Order, Defendant must obtain, within 30 days, a signed and dated acknowledgement of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a compliance report one year after entry of the Order and submit compliance notices within 14 days of certain changes for three years.

requirements.description: Submit a compliance report one year after entry of this Order, sworn under penalty of perjury, identifying contact information, all businesses, activities, compliance with each Section, and copies of Order Acknowledgements
requirements.quoted_text: One year after entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury: 1. Defendant must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission and Plaintiff may use to communicate with Defendant; (b) identify all of Defendant's businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business, including the goods and services offered, and the means of advertising, marketing and sales; (d) describe in detail whether and how Defendant is in compliance with each Section of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Order Acknowledgement obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: For three years following entry of this Order, submit a compliance notice within 14 days of any change in designated point of contact or structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has ownership interest in or controls
requirements.quoted_text: For three (3) years following entry of this Order, Defendant must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within 14 days of any change in the following: (a) any designated point of contact; or (b) the structure of Defendant or any entity that Defendant has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit to the Commission notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Defendant
requirements.quoted_text: Defendant must submit to the Commission notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Defendant within 14 days of its filing.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and maintain specific records for three years, including accounting records, personnel records, training materials, compliance documents, complaints, marketing materials, and documents demonstrating FCRA compliance.

requirements.description: Create and maintain accounting records showing revenues, costs, and net profit or loss for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold, all costs incurred in generating those revenues, and the resulting net profit or loss

requirements.description: Create and maintain personnel records showing each employee's name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title, dates of service, and reason for termination for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Personnel records showing each employee's: name, addresses, and telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and, if applicable, the reason for termination

requirements.description: Create and maintain all employee training materials for three years
requirements.quoted_text: All employee training materials

requirements.description: Create and maintain documents sufficient to demonstrate compliance with each provision of this Order for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Documents sufficient to demonstrate compliance with each provision of this Order, including, but not limited to, copies of acknowledgments of receipt of this Order, required by the Section titled "Compliance Reporting"

requirements.description: Create and maintain complaints and refund requests and any responses for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Complaints and refund requests, whether received directly or indirectly, and any responses

requirements.description: Create and maintain a copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material for three years
requirements.quoted_text: A copy of each unique advertisement or other marketing material

requirements.description: Create and maintain documents sufficient to demonstrate compliance with Section 604 of the FCRA for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Documents sufficient to demonstrate Defendant's compliance with Section 604 of the FCRA

requirements.description: Create and maintain documents sufficient to demonstrate compliance with Section 607(a) of the FCRA, including user information, certifications, and verification efforts for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Documents sufficient to demonstrate Defendant's compliance with Section 607(a) of the FCRA, including but not limited to: 1. the name, address, and telephone number of each Consumer Report user; 2. each user's certification of the purposes for which the Consumer Report information is sought; and 3. documents sufficient to demonstrate Defendant's efforts to verify the identity of each user and the uses certified by such user

requirements.description: Create and maintain documents sufficient to demonstrate compliance with Section 607(d) of the FCRA, including copies of notices provided to information furnishers and Consumer Report users for three years
requirements.quoted_text: Documents sufficient to demonstrate Defendant's compliance with Section 607(d) of the FCRA, including but not limited to: 1. a copy of each notice provided by Defendant to those who regularly furnish information to Defendant with respect to any consumer; 2. a copy of each notice provided by Defendant to those to whom a Consumer Report is provided by Defendant; and 3. the name, address, and telephone number of each person to whom Defendant provided a notice described in Subsection I(1) and I(2).

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff have the right to monitor Defendant's compliance through document requests, depositions, interviews, and other investigative means.

requirements.description: Within 14 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission or Plaintiff, submit additional compliance reports, appear for depositions, and produce documents
requirements.quoted_text: Within 14 days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission or Plaintiff, Defendant must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury; appear for depositions; and produce documents for inspection and copying. The Commission and Plaintiff are also authorized to obtain discovery, without further leave of court, using any of the procedures prescribed by Fed. R. Civ. P. 29, 30 (including telephonic depositions), 31, 33, 34, 36, 45, and 69.

requirements.description: Permit representatives of the Commission and Plaintiff to communicate directly with Defendant and interview any employee or affiliated person who has agreed to such an interview
requirements.quoted_text: For matters concerning this Order, the Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to communicate directly with Defendant. Defendant must permit representatives of the Commission and Plaintiff to interview any employee or other person affiliated with Defendant who has agreed to such an interview. The person interviewed may have counsel present.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order for three years.

requirements.description: Court retains jurisdiction for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement; case will be closed but may be re-opened upon motion for good cause within three years
requirements.quoted_text: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order. The Court directs the Clerk to close this case. The Court will re-open the case upon motion of a party for good cause within three years of this order.

provisions.title: Costs and Attorneys' Fees
provisions.summary: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees.

requirements.description: Each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action
requirements.quoted_text: each party shall bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.

provisions.title: Deadlines
provisions.summary: Deadlines in this Order may only be modified on motion to the Court for good cause shown.

requirements.description: Deadlines in this Order will only be modified on motion to the Court for good cause shown
requirements.quoted_text: The deadlines set in this Order will only be modified on motion to the Court for good cause shown.

duration.termination_text: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order. The Court directs the Clerk to close this case. The Court will re-open the case upon motion of a party for good cause within three years of this order.
